Description: Body sherd of East Greek pottery open vessel, probably a bowl; dull cream slip, mostly worn; glaze largely fired red; interior glazed; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of goat grazing to left (head and back missing); at right, possibly muzzle of second grazing goat; dots as filling ornament; below, wide black band with traces of added colour above zigzag band and two narrow bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.351)
